name: Grandma Minecci's Snowball Cookies
author: jimbeau
summary: This is my brother-in-law's favorite recipe passed down from grandmother to daughter in my wife's family for years.
ingredients: ¾ cup white sugar, or to taste
2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar, or as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Beat shortening, butter, and white sugar together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy; add eggs and vanilla extract and beat until smooth
Sift flour and salt into creamed butter mixture and stir just until dough is combined; fold in pecans
Shape dough into 1-inch balls and arrange on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 20 minutes
Cool cookies slightly and roll in confectioners' sugar
Cool cookies completely and roll again in confectioners' sugar
